Name: NerdDinner - Four Database Access Samples
Description:
[url:Chris Sells|http://www.sellsbrothers.com] worked with [url:Nick Muhonen|http://www.useableconcepts.com] from Useable Concepts and Nick created four samples exploring how an ASP.NET MVC application can access databases in the various ways you'll find in the wild:

* ADO.NET Connected (DataReaders)
* ADO.NET Disconnected (DataSets)
* LINQ to SQL
* LINQ to Entities (Entity Framework)
These samples were referenced in [url:Scott Hanselman's blog post|http://www.hanselman.com/blog/ExtendingNerdDinnerExploringDifferentDatabaseOptions.aspx] and Nick's in-depth article exploring the subject on [url:http://www.msdn.com/data].

Name: NerdDinner 1.0 Complete ASP.NET MVC Sample App
Description:
This is the first release of NerdDinner.com. This is a zip up of the Source for 1.0.

There's a complete walk through of the site available as a *FREE PDF* download at [url:http://tinyurl.com/aspnetmvc].

Name: NerdDinner 2.0 Complete ASP.NET MVC Sample App
Description:
This is a zip containing the source for the NerdDinner application, updated to ASP.NET MVC 2 and Visual Studio 2010. In addition to updating the application to leverage ASP.NET MVC 2 (e.g. Model validation), this includes the social sharing features and use of OpenAuth for login.

You can see this in action [url:http://nerddinner.com/]
